entry.string: Configuration
Global Settings
Stores the output generated by Xaraya in a cache for low latency/low overhead serving.
Enable Output Caching?
Config options can be modified, but no output caching will happen until enabled.
Output caching is disabled.
If not sure, select the default theme.
Cache this Theme Output:
Limits the disk usage of the output cache to the specified number of megabytes.
Cache Size Limit:
(in MB)
Page Output Cache Settings
If enabled, the pages generated by Xaraya are cached for reuse.
Enable Page Output Caching?
The maximum lifetime of a cached page. Set to zero for no time based expiration.
Page Cache Expiration Time:
(in hh:mm:ss)
If selected, individual item display pages will be cached.
Cache Item Display Pages?
If selected, the cache will be invalidated when new comments are posted for an item.
Flush Cached Display Page on New Comment?
If selected, the cache will be invalidated when a rating is posted for an item.
Flush Cached Display Page on New Rating:
If selected, the cache will be invalidated when a vote is caste on a poll hooked to an item.
Flush Cached Display Page on New Hooked Poll Vote?
Adds a line to the bottom of cached pages stating the cache time.
Show the "Last Modified" Stamp on Cached Pages?
If enabled, xarCache will send Expires and Cache-Control headers to the client, encouraging the page to be cached locally
Allow clients to reuse locally cached pages without re-validation?
If enabled, the cache of the session-less URLs will be regenerated upon event-based invalidation, triggered by creage/update/delete hooks
Auto-regenerate cache of session-less URL list?

If enabled, xarCache will only cache the pages of modules that have been hooked to the xarCacheModule. Note: this will not prevent cached pages from being served, only stop new pages from being cached.
Only cache pages of modules hooked to xarCacheManager:
Specify where the cached data should be stored.
Page Cache Storage:
Filesystem
Database
Memcache
Turck MMCache
eAccelerator
Limits the disk usage of the page cache to the specified number of megabytes.
Page Cache Size Limit (in MB):
Specify if cache hits and misses should be logged, e.g. in var/logs/page.log
Page Cache Logfile:
Block Output Cache Settings
If enabled, block output will be cached for reuse. Please enable hooks to blocks for per instance configuration options.
Enable Block Output Caching:
The default maximum lifetime of a cached block. Set to zero for no time based expiration.
Block Cache Expiration Time:
Block Cache Storage:
Limits the disk usage of the block cache to the specified number of megabytes.
Block Cache Size Limit:
Specify if cache hits and misses should be logged, e.g. in var/logs/block.log
Block Cache Logfile:
Update xarCacheManager Configuration
